title: Art Deco square sans on Atlas Shrugged book cover
content: Can you ID this font? [http://tinyurl.com/3at53q](http://web.archive.org/web/20110503211302/http:/tinyurl.com/3at53q "http://tinyurl.com/3at53q") Thanks
author: zzi

comments.content: Interesting. It's like a narrow [Diamante](http://web.archive.org/web/20110503211302/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsner_flake/diamante_regular/&sample_text=ATLAS%20SHRUGGED&sample_size=60) with contrast.

It's similar to this...but not it.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/capearcona/ca-no-dr/tall/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110503211302/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/capearcona/ca-no-dr/tall/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/capearcona/ca-no-dr/tall/")

Didn't Mark Simonson do this cover?

- Lex

Once upon a time there was a typeface called [Viking](http://web.archive.org/web/20110503211302/http:/www.itcfonts.com/fonts/font/pid/411997/URW+Viking+Gothic+Normal/detail), or at least that is what I knew it as. It had an alternate cap-A. This seems super close, albeit a bit [squooshed](http://web.archive.org/web/20110503211302/http:/typophile.com/wiki/squooshed).

I think the title font looks like [Raleigh Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20110503211302/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/grouptype/raleigh-gothic/) from Grouptype.It has the right R, which the [Red Rooster version](http://web.archive.org/web/20110503211302/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/raleigh-gothic-rr/) doesn't have.

- Mike Yanega

Yes, that was the cover I was thinking of.

- Lex

I'm pretty sure Mike is right about it being Raleigh Gothic. I would just add that it was stretched.

When I designed the audiobook package (the one that Stephen linked to), this was the paperback design. We used the same illustration, but I wanted to do something a bit different with the design and typography, something that fit the illustration style better (in my opinion).
